Recipe.Author: Stefan Yauchzee
Recipe.Name: Juicy Bits Clone
Recipe.Notes:
3 ounces total of Mosaic, Citra and El Dorado.  Split between boil hops above and whirlpool/dry hops below.

0.1 oz (5.7 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] at 40 minutes whirlpool 
0.1 oz (5.7 g) Citra [12.5% AA] at 40 minutes whirlpool 
0.1 oz (5.7 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] at 40 minutes whirlpool

0.40 oz (12.8 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] at 30 minutes whirlpool 
0.40 oz (12.8 g) Citra [12.5% AA] at 30 minutes whirlpool 
0.40 oz (12.8 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] at 30 minutes whirlpool

0.60 oz (17 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] at 20 minutes (when whirlpool is shut off) 
0.60 oz (17 g) Citra [12.5% AA] at 20 minutes (when whirlpool is shut off) 
0.60 oz (17 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] at 20 minutes (when whirlpool is shut off)

0.80 oz (18.4 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] dry hop for 8 days, starting at 5–5.5° Plato (1.020–1.022) 
0.80 oz (18.4 g) Citra [12.5% AA] dry hop for 8 days, starting at 5–5.5° Plato (1.020–1.022) 
0.80 oz (18.4 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] dry hop for 8 days, starting at 5–5.5° Plato (1.020–1.022)

1 oz (28 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] dry hop for 4 days 
1 oz (28 g) Citra [12.5% AA] dry hop for 4 days 
1 oz (28 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] dry hop for 4 days

For this beer, I mashed, bittered and boiled on the Z. Once that was done, I disconnected the keg, chilled to 170 and did 3 whirlpool additions. I purged the keg with co2 and chilled overnight. The next day I pitched yeast and fermented with my Brew Jacket controlling temp. First dry hop was at 4 days and the next was 4 days later. When the fermentation was close to done, I removed the air lock and put on the keg lid and poured with co2. Transfer was under pressure. I am extremely impressed with this beer.
Recipe.TastingNotes: NE Juicy IPA - Weldwerks Juicy Bits Clone

HumanBrewingSteps.LoadWaterAmendments: Load selected water amendments (generally dry ingredients go in with milled grain, liquid ingredients in start water, your recipe may vary)
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadMash: Mill grain and load into mash compartment
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadAdjuncts: Load hops and other boil/whirlpool additions into adjunct compartments:
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadFermentationAdditions: Load dry hops and fermentation additions into fermentation keg:

Content.SpecialBrewingInstructions:
3 ounces total of Mosaic, Citra and El Dorado.  Split between boil hops above and whirlpool/dry hops below.

0.1 oz (5.7 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] at 40 minutes whirlpool 
0.1 oz (5.7 g) Citra [12.5% AA] at 40 minutes whirlpool 
0.1 oz (5.7 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] at 40 minutes whirlpool

0.40 oz (12.8 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] at 30 minutes whirlpool 
0.40 oz (12.8 g) Citra [12.5% AA] at 30 minutes whirlpool 
0.40 oz (12.8 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] at 30 minutes whirlpool

0.60 oz (17 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] at 20 minutes (when whirlpool is shut off) 
0.60 oz (17 g) Citra [12.5% AA] at 20 minutes (when whirlpool is shut off) 
0.60 oz (17 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] at 20 minutes (when whirlpool is shut off)

0.80 oz (18.4 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] dry hop for 8 days, starting at 5–5.5° Plato (1.020–1.022) 
0.80 oz (18.4 g) Citra [12.5% AA] dry hop for 8 days, starting at 5–5.5° Plato (1.020–1.022) 
0.80 oz (18.4 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] dry hop for 8 days, starting at 5–5.5° Plato (1.020–1.022)

1 oz (28 g) Mosaic [13.1% AA] dry hop for 4 days 
1 oz (28 g) Citra [12.5% AA] dry hop for 4 days 
1 oz (28 g) El Dorado [14.8% AA] dry hop for 4 days

For this beer, I mashed, bittered and boiled on the Z. Once that was done, I disconnected the keg, chilled to 170 and did 3 whirlpool additions. I purged the keg with co2 and chilled overnight. The next day I pitched yeast and fermented with my Brew Jacket controlling temp. First dry hop was at 4 days and the next was 4 days later. When the fermentation was close to done, I removed the air lock and put on the keg lid and poured with co2. Transfer was under pressure. I am extremely impressed with this beer.

Reviews.Content:
Really liked this beer.  Ended up subbing in extra Citra for some of the other hops due to local availability.  So juicy and floral.  

I also programmed the three whirlpool stages into the PicoBrew with the editor, which was interesting to dig into on my second ever batch.

I see why it's called "Juicy Bits".  It really is juicy tasting.  I ended up letting it ferment 1 extra day because of a scheduling conflict, but the beer tastes very, very good.  Aroma is soooo nice.  Very hoppy.  The flavor is a hoppy, fruity taste.  I followed the directions to a T except for that extra day fermenting and that I transferred via siphon.  I recommend this.
